question: Question_01_(b)
statement:
\emph{Multiple Choice question: Select ONE correct answer. You will not
be graded for any work.}

You are out fishing. Every time you cast your line, the probability that
you catch a fish is 1/4. What is the probability that you catch at least
one fish within the first 2 attempts?

(a) 1/16

(b) 7/16

(c) 1/2

(d) 9/16

(e) 15/16
sols:
This is a Bernoulli process with probability of success \emph{p = 1/4},
and \emph{n = 2} repetitions.

Let \emph{X} be the random variable that counts the number of successful
casts. Then

\begin{align*}
\text{Prob(at least 1 success)} &= \text{Prob}(X \geq 1) \\
&= \text{Prob}(X = 1 \text{ or } X = 2) \\
&= \text{Prob}(X = 1) + \text{Prob}(X = 2) \\
&= C(2,1)\left(\frac14\right)^1 \left(1-\frac14\right)^{2-1} \\
&\text{ }+ C(2,2)\left(\frac14\right)^2 \left(1-\frac14\right)^{2-2} \\
&= \frac7{16}.
\end{align*}

Hence, answer \textbf{(b)} is correct.
hints:
This is a Bernoulli process. What is your random variable? What is
\emph{n}, what is \emph{p}?
